SummaryFile Object¶

Summary¶

This object encapsulates the entire state of the summary file.

A summary file is where we store the object attributes by serializing them.

Summary files are stores in ./summaries.

Current Status¶

The SummaryFile object is fully operational.

Future Work¶

There is no planned future work.

Known Bugs¶

There are no known bugs.

Source Code¶

class PyStrahl.core.file.SummaryFile(sum_fn=None, verbosity=False)[source]¶

This object encapsulates the entire state of the summary file.

A summary file is where we store the object attributes by serializing them.

Summary files are stores in ./summaries.

__init__(sum_fn=None, verbosity=False)[source]¶

Initializes a SummaryFile object

Parameters:
  • sum_fn (str) -- The summary file name
  • verbosity (bool) -- Turns on and off verbose ouput
verbose¶

bool -- Determines if verbose execution is used

create(sum_fn=None)[source]¶

Creates or loads a summary file

If a summary file name is not provided then the user is prompted for one and the files inside of ./summaries is provided for reference. The summary file name must also end in either .json or .hdf5 in order to be created and compatible with serialization techniques implemented.

Parameters:sum_fn (str) -- The summary file name.
fn¶

str -- The input file name.

path¶

str -- The path to the input file.

serial¶

str -- The type of serialization for this summary file

attributes()[source]¶

Prints out all of the attributes of the SummaryFile object
